result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grant Noble Searer

records.addlTxt: 21CM262, 21CM263, 22CM11 & 22CM95 Cases called @ 2:17 PM Defendant Grant Noble Searer in court.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Grant Noble Searer.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Blankschein advises that she is not prepared to proceed with the final pre-trial conference today as she has concerns about the defendant's competency to proceed and is requesting another competency examination be ordered. Statement by Atty Blankschein regarding her concerns. The Court does not believe that there has been a substantial change that would require another examination be ordered. The Court questions the defendant and denies the request for another competency evaluation. The Court will proceed with the final pre-trial conference. Court addresses the State's motion for joinder. Argument by DA Leusink. Argument by Atty Blankschein - does object to the motion for joinder. The Court finds that joinder is appropriate and does grant the State's Motion for Joinder. The Court addressed the 906.09 motion filed by the State. Statement by Atty Blankschein - does voice and objection to I through X. Court makes statement and instructs defendant regarding impeachment-answer is yes, and correct number is 21.  Court further instructs defendant regarding answer and consequences of answer-Defendant states the instructions are understood. Court addresses defense motion in limine. The Court grants defense motions in limine 3,4,5, 6, 8 & 11. The Court denies 1, 2 & 7. Court addresses State motion in limine. No objection by Attorney Blankschein. The Court questions counsel regarding the amount of time needed for trial. The Court believes that the matter can be tried in one day. Atty Blankschein requests the opportunity to file any additional motions that may arise. The Court will allow Atty Blankschein the opportunity to file any additional motions that may be necessary.
State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions
State's Proposed Verdict Form
State's Proposed Jury Instructions
State's Motion to Admit Statements
State's Motion for Joinder
State's Motion in Limine
Defendant's Motion in Limine
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions
Scheduling Order
Final pre-trial on September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

21CM262, 21CM263, 22CM11 & 22CM95 Cases called @ 9:58 AM Defendant Grant Noble Searer in court.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Grant Noble Searer. The parties have received the competency report. The defendant does maintain that he is not competent to proceed and the parties are requesting testimony of the doctor. The State does not intend to call Dr. Benson and will stand by the report that was provided as evidence. Argument by Atty Blankschein regarding the defendant's position regarding his lack of competency to proceed. Argument by DA Leusink. The Court finds the defendant competent to proceed for reasons stated on the record. Atty Blankschein requests a FPT be scheduled. The Court orders defense pre-trial motions by filed by September 1, 2022. State's motions to be filed by no later than September 15, 2022.
Order for Reassignment of Cases from Judge Dutcher to Judge Blader signed by Chief Judge Dutcher on 8/1/2022 filed in 2022GF27.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by phone for Grant Noble Searer. Court advises that a competency hearing is needed.
Competency hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Competency hearing on August 4, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Review hearing on May 25, 2022 at 08:00 am.

22CM95, 21CM262, 21CM263 & 22CM11 Cases called @ 10:53 AM Defendant Grant Noble Searer in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Grant Noble Searer. 22CM95 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Atty Blankschein does not wish to enter a plea due to competency concerns that are present. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:35 am.
Signature Bond Signed - $2500 - 5/17/2022
Letter from Dr. Benson requesting extension of the time to file competency report
Letter to Court from ADA Kottke in response to Dr. Benson's request
Letter from Dr. Benson advising of his difficulty in making arrangements to complete the evaluation - requesting the Court's assistance
Status conference on May 31, 2022 at 10:35 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Wesley Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Grant Noble Searer. Atty Blankschein requesting another STC as the doctor requested additional time to complete the evaluation.
Letter from Dr. Benson requesting extension of the time to file the competency report

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared in court for Grant Noble Searer, Attorney Wesley Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Attny Blankschein raises a concern regarding competency, Court orders 971.14 Competency Evaluation

Case called @ 02:02 PM Defendant Grant Noble Searer in court with attorney Emma K Blankschein. Defendant appears by phone.  Wesley J Kottke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom.   Atty Blankschein makes a special appearance on behalf of the SPD Office. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP entered. Bond argument by ADA Kottke.  Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
